recipe.name: Eye of Newt and Toe Of Frog
recipe.description: This recipe is somewhat of an acquired taste but is a traditional favourite amongst some demographics in certain areas of Scotland. While some may find the concoction to be rather foul, others may find it to be rather fair; it's all in how you suggest it's value to yourself.
recipe.ingredients: 1 fillet of fenny snake 2 eyes of newt 1 foot of frog 1/2 ball of wool of bat 1 tongue of dog 2 forks of adder 7 stings of blind worm 4 legs of lizard 1 wing of howlet 1 gallon of swamp water
recipe.directions: Bring a large cauldron of swamp water to a full boil. Slowly add ingredients while cackling incessantly and stirring with a large wooden stick. Loudly state the name of each ingredient in pig latin before dropping it into the cauldron. Once all ingredients have been added, let cauldron sit for 30 minutes. Do the hokey-pokey, turn yourself around and then enjoy! One gallon of swamp water feeds four adults.

recipe.name: Stuffed Mushrooms
recipe.description: Fast and delicious recipe. Main course or addition to steak. I myself came up with it and since then my family and friends loved it!
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 kg white mushrooms 1/2 cup rice 1 pack of bacon 1/4 pack of butter 3 carrots 1/2 kg cheese 3 cups whater spices 1 teaspoon salt 1 potato
recipe.directions: Wash the mushrooms and the carrots. Separate the stemps of the mushrooms and cut them into small pieces. Cut the carrots and the potato on small cubes. Mix them with chopped bacon, rice, salt and spices. Put the butter in a pan and fry the mixture for 5 minutes. Arrange the rest of the mushrooms in a baking dish and stuff them with the mixture you just fried. Pour the water and add the cheese on top. Bake for 25 - 30 minutes in oven on 250 degrees.

recipe.name: Blended Japanese Curry and Rice
recipe.description: This has been my favorite dish since my childhood. This is a modified version of a typical way of making Japanese curry. The curry sauce is mostly sold in the form of packaged roux blocks. Brands such as Glico, House and S&B are popular and can be easily found in Asian food markets. This recipe uses a large sized package which are usually about 220g. It is very easy to make.
recipe.ingredients: Big box (220g) of Japanese curry sauce 3 carrots, chopped 2 medium sized onions, chopped 2 stalks of celery, finely chopped 4 cloves of garlic, minced 2 tablespoons of powdered soup stock 2 chicken breasts, diced 4 cups water
recipe.directions: In a large pot, combine carrots, onions, celery and garlic; cook with a bit of oil for 10 to 15 minutes on medium heat until vegetables are half tender. Add water and soup stock and bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium and cook for an addition 10 minutes until completely tender. While letting it simmer until it is warm, cook diced chicken in a seperate pan with oil. Split half of the vegetables and water from the pot into a blender to blend into a soup. Put blended vegetables back into pot along with the remaining vegetables; add cooked chicken. Put on low heat; add curry blocks and mix until it dissolves. Serve with cooked rice. Makes 10 servings.

recipe.name: Jan's Spaghetti and Meatballs
recipe.description: This is a recipe for a delicious version of spaghetti and meatballs. It is relatively simple to make, and well worth it!
recipe.ingredients: 500 grams ground beef 1 chopped onion 1 egg 1/4 cup bread crumbs Montreal steak spice to taste (about 1 teaspoon) 1 tsp cooking oil 2 cans spaghetti sauce (or 1 can spaghetti and 1 can tomato sauce) 1 can chopped tomatoes 1/2 cup red wine 1 chopped onion 2 chopped celery stalks 2 minced garlic cloves 1 Tblsp. cooking oil
recipe.directions: Mix beef, onion, egg, bread crumbs and steak spice. Form into small balls and cook in oil in frying pan on medium-low heat until brown. Saut? onion, celery and garlic in cooking oil in large saucepan. Add sauce, tomatoes, wine and meatballs. Let simmer on low heat for an hour. Serve over spaghetti pasta.

recipe.name: Indian Butter Chicken
recipe.description: null
recipe.ingredients: * 1 tablespoon peanut oil * 1 shallot, finely chopped * 1/4 white onion, chopped * 2 tablespoons butter * 2 teaspoons lemon juice * 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste * 1 teaspoon garam masala * 1 teaspoon chili powder * 1 teaspoon ground cumin * 1 bay leaf * 1/4 cup plain yogurt * 1 cup half-and-half * 1 cup tomato puree * 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste * 1 pinch salt * 1 pinch black pepper * * 1 tablespoon peanut oil * 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-size pieces * 1 teaspoon garam masala * 1 pinch cayenne pepper * 1 tablespoon cornstarch * 1/4 cup water
recipe.directions: 1. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Saute shallot and onion until soft and translucent. Stir in butter, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon garam masala, chili powder, cumin and bay leaf. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add tomato sauce, and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in half-and-half and yogurt. Reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Season with salt pepper. Remove from heat and set aside. 2. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat, and season with 1 teaspoon garam masala and cayenne. Stir in a few spoonfuls of sauce, and simmer until liquid has reduced, and chicken is no longer pink. Stir cooked chicken into sauce. 3. Mix together cornstarch and water, then stir into the sauce. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes, or until thickened.

recipe.name: Salsa Chicken
recipe.description: This is a modern North American meal. I came upon it at my girlfriends house and have made it my own
recipe.ingredients: 2 Thinly cut Chicken Breasts 1 cup of Louisiana Style Hot Sauce 512ml Bottle of Mild Salsa Shredded Cheese 1 Green Pepper 1 Onion Noodles of any kind (Penne recommended)
recipe.directions: Boil water and cook the noodles to concistency your looking for. Cook the chicken in a pan with cooking oil until the chicken is no longer pink. While this is cooking chop the green pepper and onion into sizes of your desire. Once the chicken is no longer pink put in the vegetables and throw in the cup of hot sauce and the bottle of salsa. Let this cook for approx 4-5 min or until the veggies are no longer crunchy. Now it is ready to serve, serve the pasta then put as much of the chicken mixture on the pasta as is desired and then take some of the shredded cheese and add it on top of the pasta! Bon Appetite!!!

recipe.name: Chocolate Honey Cake
recipe.description: This is a delicious dessert to serve your family. It is my Grandma's special recipe. It is already sweet because of the honey, but the chocolate makes it all the tastier.
recipe.ingredients: 2 eggs 1 tsp. baking powder 3/4 cup honey-liquid cinnamon 1 cup sugar 4 tsp. cocoa (heaping) 1/2 cup oil 1 cup coffee (cool) 1 tsp. soda 2 cups flour
recipe.directions: Stir ingredients well in big bowl. Bake 325 oven 1 hour approx. Add raisins + nuts (optional). Line pan with wax paper.

recipe.name: Crepes
recipe.description: This is a a special french recipe that tastes delicious.
recipe.ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour 2 eggs 1 cup milk 1/4 teaspoon salt 2 teaspoons vegetable oil 4 red chilies 2 cups of fluid chocolate
recipe.directions: Put all ingredients together and mix them well until they form a fluid dough Then heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crepe Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly Cook the crepe for about 2 minutes, until the bottom is light brown. Loosen with a spatula, turn and cook the other side At the end put the chocolate and the red chilies on the crepe Serve hot.

recipe.name: Baked Chicken Paprika
recipe.description: This is a simple recipe for baked chicken with a simple paprika flavouring and a sour cream sauce.
recipe.ingredients: 5 pounds chicken pieces 3 tablespoons butter 3 tablespoons oil 1 1/2 cup finely chopped onion 1 teaspoon sweet Hungarian paprika 4 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules Water -- Enough To Cover 2 tablespoons Flour 2 cups Sour Cream
recipe.directions: Add butter, oil, onion, paprika, bouillon and water to a Dutch Oven, heat to boiling. Add chicken. Simmer covered until tender. Remove chicken, then bone and skin the chicken pieces. Add flour to sour cream. Add mixture to chicken. Heat until sour cream is just hot, do not boil. Serves four.

recipe.name: Baked Chicken Paprika
recipe.description: This is a simple recipe for baked chicken with a simple paprika flavouring and a sour cream sauce.
recipe.ingredients: 5 pounds chicken pieces 3 tablespoons butter 3 tablespoons oil 1 1/2 cup finely chopped onion 1 teaspoon sweet Hungarian paprika 4 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules Water -- Enough To Cover 2 tablespoons Flour 2 cups Sour Cream
recipe.directions: Add butter, oil, onion, paprika, bouillon and water to a Dutch Oven, heat to boiling. Add chicken. Simmer covered until tender. Remove chicken, then bone and skin the chicken pieces. Add flour to sour cream. Add mixture to chicken. Heat until sour cream is just hot, do not boil. Serves four.

recipe.name: Spicy Mexican Rice
recipe.description: This will make a spicy, stew-like dish. Rice mixed with tomato, onion, corn, peppers, and spice.
recipe.ingredients: 3 cups parboiled rice 6 cups water (see step 2 below) 1 large can diced tomatoes (see step 2 below) 1 tsp salt 1 tsp oregano 1 tsp chili powder 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper (adjust acording to your taste) 1 can corn, drained 1/4 cup diced onion 1/2 of a green pepper, diced 3 green onion stalks chopped
recipe.directions: 1. Saute onion and green pepper, until tender. 2. Drain the juice from the canned tomatoes into a measuring cup. Add enough water to the juice to make a total of 6 cups of liquid. 3. Place liquid, onions and green peppers and all other ingredients, including the rice, into a pot. 4. Cover and bring to a boil. After the water boils, turn the burner down to the lowest setting, and let simmer until all water has been absorbed. Takes 25 to 30 minutes.

recipe.name: Chocolate-Mocha Parfait
recipe.description: This is a delicious dessert recipe. Set aside several parfait or regular glasses before beginning.
recipe.ingredients: 1 cup of strong hot coffee 1/2 pkg of chocolate wafers 1/2 pkg. marshmallows 1 cup whipping cream
recipe.directions: Dissolve marshmallows in hot coffee. Let the mixture cool until syrupy. Whip whipping cream and blend into coffee mixture. Layer mixture into parfait glasses, alternating with crushed chocolate cookie crumbs. Chill, then serve.

recipe.name: Green Thai Curry
recipe.description: A rich and spicy Thai green curry with shrimp, cubed tofu and a selection of vegetables including green beans, broccoli and green pepper served with fragrant Jasmine rice.
recipe.ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola or peanut oil 1 onion ? finely chopped 1 kaffir lime leaf ? finely chopped (or ? teaspoon lime zest) 2 teaspoons Thai green curry paste (or 3 teaspoons for a hotter curry) 2 cloves garlic ? finely chopped 1 cup coconut milk 1 cup fish, chicken or vegetable stock 2 tablespoons fish sauce 1 tablespoon brown sugar ? teaspoon salt 1 cup small broccoli florets ? green pepper (capsicum) ? julienned 1 cup green beans ? ends trimmed and cut in half 3? oz (100g) firm tofu ? cubed 1 cup Jasmine rice 12 large uncooked shrimp (prawns) ? peeled, deveined and bottom of tail left intact 2 tablespoons cornstarch (corn flour) mixed to a paste with 2 tablespoons water 2 tablespoons lime juice 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro
recipe.directions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat and cook the onion for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the chopped kaffir lime leaf (or lime zest), curry paste and garlic and cook, stirring, for a minute. Add the coconut milk, stock, fish sauce, sugar and salt, and then bring to a boil. Add the broccoli, green pepper, green beans and tofu, cover with a lid, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 12 minutes. While the curry simmers, cook the rice. Add the shrimp and cabbage to the curry and simmer, covered, for a further 5 minutes. Add the cornstarch paste and stir continuously until the curry thickens, then stir in the lime juice and cilantro.

recipe.name: Tomato Soup Cake
recipe.description: Grandma Wilson kept the name of this affordable treat a secret until we asked for seconds. She lived through the Great Depression, and so she had all kinds of tasty budget recipes. I was unable to find her original but I am sure she would have approved of this one. It comes from a book by MFK Fisher entitled "How to Cook a Wolf".
recipe.source: adapted from MFK Fisher - "How to Cook a Wolf"
recipe.ingredients: 3 tablespoons butter or shortening 1 cup sugar 1 teaspoon baking soda 1 can tomato soup ( about 15 ounces?) 2 cups flour 1 teaspoon cinnamon 1 teaspoon nutmeg, ginger, cloves mixed 1 1/2 cup raisins, nuts, chopped figs, what you will
recipe.directions: Cream butter, add the sugar, and blend thoroughly, Add the baking soda to the soup, stirring well, and add this alternately to the first mixture with the flour and spices sifted together. Stir well, and bake in a pan or loaf tin at 325 (F). (RJPW - optional - Once cooked, brush with melted butter and dust with sugar and allow to cool. Leave the main ingredient as a mystery until people ask.)

recipe.name: Linzer Torte
recipe.description: This is a family favorite, usually served around christmas time, its also the oldest known cake in the world.
recipe.ingredients: 1/2cup whole almonds, toasted 1-1/2cups all-purpose flour 1teaspoon ground cinnamon 1/4teaspoon salt 3/4cup granulated sugar 1/2cup butter, softened 1/2teaspoon grated lemon peel 1egg 3/4cup raspberry or apricot jam Sifted powdered sugar
recipe.directions:
1.Process almonds in food processor until ground, but not pasty. Preheat oven to 375?F. Combine flour, almonds, cinnamon and salt in medium bowl; set aside. Beat granulated sugar, butter and lemon peel in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed about 5 minutes or until light and fluffy, scraping down side of bowl once. Beat in egg until well blended. Beat in flour mixture at low speed until well blended.
2.Spoon 2/3 of dough onto bottom of 10-inch tart pan with removable bottom. Pat dough evenly over bottom and up side of pan. Spread jam over bottom of dough. Roll remaining 1/3 of dough on lightly floured surface into 10X5-inch rectangle. Cut dough into ten 1/2-inch-wide strips using pizza wheel or sharp knife.
3.Arrange 4 or 5 strips of dough lengthwise across jam. Arrange another 4 or 5 strips of dough crosswise across top. Trim and press ends of dough strips into edge of crust. Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Remove torte from pan. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cut into wedges. Store, tightly covered, at room temperature 1 to 2 days.

recipe.name: Chocolate Crinkles
recipe.description: These tantalizingly decadent cookies are a chocolate lover's fantasy. Eat them quickly, as these delicious treats won't last long in any house.
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 cup vegetable oil 4 squares unsweetened chocolate (4 oz.) melted 2 cups granulated sugar 4 eggs 2 tsp. vanilla 2 cups all-purpose flour 2 tsp. baking powder 1/2 tsp. salt 1 cup confectioners sugar
recipe.directions: Mix oil, chocolate and granulated sugar. Blend in one egg at a time until well mixed. Add vanilla. Stir flour, baking powder and salt into oil mixture. Chill several hours or overnight. Heat oven tp 350 F. Drop tsp. of dough into confectioners sugar. Roll in sugar, and shape into balls. Place about 2" apart on greased baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes. Do not overbake. Makes 6 dozen.

recipe.name: Nonna's Potatoes
recipe.description: This simple, but delicious recipe is something my Italian grandmother created when I was a kid. To this day, it is still one of my favourite things to eat.
recipe.spices: Montreal Steak Spice/The Keg Steak Spice
recipe.ingredients: 2 cups of potatoes, 4 cups of water, table spoon of salt, a few tablespoons of oil, healthy serving of Montreal/The Keg steak spice
recipe.directions: First, bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a pot. While the pot is boiling, pre-heat the oven to 375F. Once the water is finished boiling, throw in the salt and potatoes. Reduce heat. After simmering potatoes for about 15-20 minutes, remove from heat and strain the water. Next, place the potatoes on a well oiled cooking sheet. Load the potatoes (and I mean LOAD) them with your steak spice of choice. Place the spiced potatoes into the oven and let them roast until golden brown. For the best results, reduce the heat of the oven and let them cook for an hour or two. This will get them nice and crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. DELICIOUS!

recipe.name: Nonna's Potatoes
recipe.description: This simple, but delicious recipe is something my Italian grandmother created when I was a kid. To this day, it is still one of my favourite things to eat.
recipe.spices: Montreal Steak Spice/The Keg Steak Spice
recipe.ingredients: 2 cups of potatoes, 4 cups of water, table spoon of salt, a few tablespoons of oil, healthy serving of Montreal/The Keg steak spice
recipe.directions: First, bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a pot. While the pot is boiling, pre-heat the oven to 375F. Once the water is finished boiling, throw in the salt and potatoes. Reduce heat. After simmering potatoes for about 15-20 minutes, remove from heat and strain the water. Next, place the potatoes on a well oiled cooking sheet. Load the potatoes (and I mean LOAD) them with your steak spice of choice. Place the spiced potatoes into the oven and let them roast until golden brown. For the best results, reduce the heat of the oven and let them cook for an hour or two. This will get them nice and crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. DELICIOUS!

recipe.name: Corn Latkes
recipe.description: null
recipe.ingredients: 225 gr corn 2 eggs 2 spoons flour 2 spoons milk salt canola oil
recipe.directions: Put in a bowl the eggs, flour and milk and mix with a fork. Add canola oil to frying pan and heat. Put small chuncks of mixture on the frying pan and fry until golden from both sides. Make 2 servings.

recipe.name: Pickled Chanterelle Mushroom Salad
recipe.description: This is a delicious salad I've made at a restaurant I worked at. Though the duck prosciutto and marinated mushrooms must be started long in advance, they can be made and eaten on their own.
recipe.spices: Mustard seed Dill seed Black peppercorn
recipe.ingredients:
500ml cleaned chanterelle mushrooms 1 small white onion 200ml water 100ml white vinegar 200ml white sugar 3 cloves of garlic 3 bay leaves 1tsp mustard seed 1tsp dill seed 1tsp whole black peppercorns
2 Boneless duck breasts 500ml kosher or sea salt 150ml raw sugar Cheesecloth
100ml Baco Noir balsamic vinegar 300ml soybean oil 1tsp grainy mustard 1tsp thyme
Mache lettuce Oka or Niagara Gold cheese
recipe.directions:
Pickled Chanterelle mushrooms: Cut or pull apart any large mushrooms. Heat a large sauce pan on medium-high heat and cook the mushrooms, stirring frequently, for 5-10 minutes, until the liquid they have released is dried. Combine the onion, water, vinegar, white sugar, garlic, bay leaves, mustard seed, dill seed and peppercorns in a pot and bring to a boil. Pour the mixture over top of the mushrooms. Boil a large mason jar, with its lid, for a few minutes to sterilize it, then pour the mushrooms and pickling liquid in, and seal. Refrigerate them for at least two weeks.
Duck Prosciutto: Mix the sea salt and raw sugar together. Place about an inch of salt on the bottom of a plastic container, and then lay the breasts side by side on top, leaving some room between them. Pour the rest of the salt and sugar mixture over top, making sure there is some around the edges of the breasts. Refrigerate them for a day. Rinse them off and dry them, and then wrap them individually in two or three layers of cheesecloth, tie it securely and hang them in a cool, dry place. A walk in fridge is ideal, but a cool cellar will work. Leave them to dry for 10-20 days. Remove them from the cheesecloth and carve off any grayness or overly dried areas.
Dressing: Combine balsamic vinegar and grainy mustard and thyme. Whisk vigorously while slowly pouring in the soybean oil. This can be done in a food processor. Ideally it should take a few minutes to pour in all the oil. If done correctly, the dressing will not split. Season as needed.
Combine a quantity of mache lettuce with a quarter as much of pickled chanterelle mushrooms. Toss with the balsamic dressing, and serve with thinly sliced pieces of duck prosciutto and cheese.

recipe.name: Jollof Rice
recipe.description: This is a traditional Ghanaian recipe. It is usually spicy and served with chicken or fried plantain and salad
recipe.ingredients: 2 ripe tomatoes half a packet of rice 1 onion, chopped 1 garlic cloves, finely chopped 3 hot peppers (or powdered chilli) 3 teaspoons vegetable oil 1 can chicken broth 5 chicken drumsticks 1 tablespoon salt 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peel 1 glass water
recipe.directions: In a medium saucepan, heat up the teaspoons of oil and fry onions till goldreb brown. Pour blended tomatoes into pan and let it simmer for 20 mins. Add chopped garlic, pepper, spices and can of broth. Allow to simmer for extra 5 mins. Pour packet of rice till theres enough sauce just to cook it. Boil under low heat for extra 20 mins. Serve for four with grilled or fried chicken.

recipe.name: Crazy Spice Cake
recipe.description: This is a simple yet flavourful cake my family makes for birthdays. For those who like it hot, the original recipe actually calls for twice the amount of the spices listed here.
recipe.ingredients: 1 1/2 cup flour 1/2 cup wh. sugar 1/2 cup br sugar 1/2 tsp. cinnamon 1/4 tsp. ginger 1/4 tsp. nutmeg 1/8 tsp. cloves 1 tsp. baking soda 1/2 tsp. salt 5 Tbsp. vegetable oil 1 Tbsp. vinegar 1 tsp. vanilla 1 cup cold water
recipe.directions: Sift together flour, sugars, spices, soda & salt. make 3 holes in the mixture, fill one with vanilla, one with vinegar, and one with oil. Pour water over all; stir gently until just mixed. Pour into a greased 8-inch baking pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until it tests done with a toothpick. Frost or serve with whipped topping.

recipe.name: Tarator Soup
recipe.description: This is a traditional bulgarian cucumber soup. I found the recipe on-line and changed slightely to my taste. It's cold, sharp, tart and refreshing. It's easy and fast to make and very low calorie.
recipe.ingredients: 2 cucumbers, peeled and chopped 1 garlic clove, minced 4 cups plain yoghurt 1/2 cup water 1/4 teaspoon salt 2 Tablespoons dill, chopped toasted almond slices
recipe.directions: In a saucepan, combine yoghurt, water, cucumbers, garlic, dill, salt and mix well. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. When ready to serve, ladle into bowls and sprinkle with toasted almonds.

recipe.name: HASH BROWN POTATO CASSEROLE
recipe.description: A Simple Hash Brown Casserole thats quick and easy to make, cream of mushroom soup can be used instead of cream of chicken
recipe.ingredients: 2 lb. bag of hashbrowns thawed 1 onion, chopped 2 cups grated cheese 1 small carton sour cream 1 can (10 oz.) cream of chicken soup salt and pepper to taste 1 cup Corn Flake Crumbs 1/3 cup butter, melted
recipe.directions: Mix together all of the ingredients except the corn flakes and butter. Put in a 9"x13" pan. Mix together Corn Flakes and butter. Spread on top of potato mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 1 hour.

recipe.name: Pho Bo
recipe.description: Popular Vietnamese noodle based soup which has become extremely popular throughout North America due to its low cost and taste.
recipe.ingredients: 2 cups grated fresh or packaged unsweetened coconut 4 cups beef broth (1 box per cup) 1 (1/4-inch thick) slice ginger 4 whole star anise 1 cinnamon stick 1/2 pound piece boneless beef sirloin, trimmed of any fat 3 ounces dried flat rice noodles* 1/4 cup Asian fish sauce* 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 1 cup fresh bean sprouts, rinsed and drained 1/8 cup minced scallions 1/4 cup fresh cilantro sprigs, washed and finely chopped 1 small thin fresh red or green Asian chilie, sliced very thin 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves Lime wedges for garnish
recipe.directions: In a 2 quart saucepan bring broth, ginger, star anise, and cinnamon to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. With a very sharp knife cut sirloin across the grain into very thin slices. In a large bowl soak noodles in hot water to cover 15 minutes, or until softened and pliable. While noodles are soaking, bring a kettle of salted water to a boil for noodles. Drain noodles in a colander and cook in boiling water, stirring 45 seconds, or until tender. Drain noodles in a colander. Set aside. Strain broth into saucepan and bring to a boil. Stir in fish sauce, salt and pepper. Add sirloin and sprouts and cook 30 to 45 seconds, or until sirloin changes color. Skim any froth from soup. To serve, divide noodles into 4 bowls. Ladle soup over noodles. Sprinkle scallion greens, cilantro, chilies and basil over soup and serve with lime wedges

recipe.name: Kommstborscht (Summer Borscht)
recipe.description: This is a traditional German soup. It is very hardy and tasts great with a little sour cream add before you eat.
recipe.ingredients: 2-3 lbs. ham bone 4 qt. water 1 bay leaf and parsley or beet leaves(chopped finely) 1 stalk rhubarb (optional) 3-4 medium potatoes, diced small red pepper (optional)
recipe.directions: Simmer ham bones, water and onion for 2 hours or until the ham falls off the bone. Add remaining ingredients and let simmer for at least 2 hours. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with sour cream, if desired.

recipe.name: Cherry Cheese Cake
recipe.description: This is my favourite recipe for cheesecake. It comes from my grandmother and has been popular among friends and family.
recipe.ingredients: Bottom layer: 2 cups of graham cracker crumbs, 1/2 cup of butter 1/2 cup of brown sugar Filling: 1 package of Philly Cream Cheese 1 cup of icing sugar 1 package of Dream Whip Topping: 1 can of cherry filling
recipe.directions: Mix together the ingredients for the bottom layer and put in 10 by 12 inch panand chill for approx. 15 minutes Filling - Beat Philly cream cheese with icing sugar. Mix 1 package of Dream Whip and fold into cheese mixture. Spread filling over cracker crumbs. Topping - Spread one can of cherry filling over cheese mixture and chill in fridge for 24 hours.

recipe.name: Chocolate Muffins
recipe.description: This is great desert for chocolate lovers and people who are avoiding spicy deserts. This particular recipe will make a dozen muffins.
recipe.source: A pamphlet handed out in a supermarket a long time ago.
recipe.ingredients: -2 eggs -1 cup or 250 mL milk -2 cups or 500 mL all-purpose flour -1 1/2 cup or 350 mL chocolate chips -1/2 cup or 125 mL cocoa powder -1/2 cup or 125 mL sugar -1/8 tsp of salt -1/8 tsp of cayenne pepper -1 tbsp or 15 mL baking powder -1/4 cup or 50 mL vegetable oil
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 375F or 190C. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, chocolate powder, sugar, baking powder, chocolate chips and salt. In a seperate large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, oil and cayenne pepper. Slowly add the dry ingredients from the small bowl into the wet ingredients in the large bowl while whisking. Keep whisking thoroughly until all the ingredients are completely blended. Lightly grease the muffin pan and sprinkle it with cocoa. Using an ice cream scoop, place a ball of the mixture into every slot in the pan. Slide the pan into the oven and let the muffins bake for 20 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean with a few crumbs. Let the muffins cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Kimchi Pancakes
recipe.description: Kimchi is a traditional spicy Korean salad made of cabbage. Kimchi can be bought from any local Korean market.
recipe.ingredients: 1 cup flour 1/2 cup water 1/2 teaspoon salt 1 cup cabbage kimchi, minced 2 tablespoons green onions, minced 1 teaspoon garlic clove, minced 2 teaspoons sesame oil
recipe.directions: Mix flour, water and salt together and combine with the rest of the ingredients to create a thick "pancake" batter. Heat 2 Tablespoons oil. Place 1/4 of the batter in the pan to form a pancake. Fry until both sides are golden. Reduce heat to low and cook all the way through. Repeat with remaining portions.

recipe.name: Barbecued Short Ribs
recipe.description: This recipe for short ribs is very popular in our area. The meat is fork-tender, and the sauce is wonderfully tangy. We're retired now but raised beef for many years. We still put this recipe to good use. Prep Time:1hr 15min Cook Time:1hr 15min Ready in:2hrs 30min
recipe.ingredients: 3 1/2 pounds beef short ribs 1 1/2 cups water 1 medium onion, sliced 1 tablespoon vinegar SAUCE: 1/2 cup ketchup 1/4 cup chopped onion 2 tablespoons lemon juice 2 garlic cloves, minced 1 teaspoon sugar 1/2 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon pepper
recipe.directions: 1. In a Dutch oven, combine ribs, water, onion and vinegar; bring to a boil. Reduce hat; cover and simmer for 1 hour, turning ribs occasionally. Drain. Place ribs in a single layer in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish. Combine sauce ingredients; spoon over ribs. Cover and bake at 325 degrees F for 1-1/4 hours or until meat is tender.

recipe.name: Fried Wonton
recipe.description: It is a type of dumpling commonly found in a number of Chinese cuisines. Wonton is made with a thin ten centimeter square lye-water pastry wrapper made of wheat flour, water, salt and lye. It is often filled with minced meat, but vegetarian fillings can be substituted.
recipe.ingredients: 4 dried black mushrooms, 1 leaf bok choy, 1 green onion, 1/2 pound ground pork, 1 tablespoon dark soy sauce, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 teaspoon granulated sugar, pinch of salt, 1 egg, lightly beaten, 3 cups oil for deep-frying, 48 wonton wrappers and water
recipe.directions:
Wipe any dirt off the mushrooms. Soak in warm water until softened(20 to 30 minutes). Squeeze out the excess water and chop. Wash and shred the bok choy leaf. Wash and dice the green onion. Mince the ginger until you have 1/2 teaspoons.
In a medium bowl, combine the ground with the dark soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar and salt. Add the lightly beaten egg and the vegetables. This is wonton filling.
Heat the oil to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. While the oil is heating, prepare the wontons. Lay a wonton wrapper in front of you. Place a teaspoon of the filling in the middle. Fold up the wonton so that it resembles a nurse's cap, wetting the edges to seal .
Add the won tons to the hot oil, a few at a time, sliding them in carefully. Deep-fry the wontons in batches until they are golden brown, turning to make sure they brown evenly. Drain on paper towels or a tempura rack if you have one. As with egg rolls, wontons should be served as soon as possible, to ensure they remain crispy. Serve with Sweet and Sour Sauce or red rice wine vinegar.

recipe.name: Plain Paratha
recipe.description: A paratha can be eaten simply with a blob of butter spread on top but it is best served with pickles and yoghurt, or thick spicy curries of meat and vegetables. Some people prefer to roll up the paratha into a tube and eat it with tea, often dipping the paratha into the tea.
recipe.ingredients: For Dough: 2 Cups Wheat Flour 1/2 tsp salt oil 1/2 cup Ghee/butter/Margarine water
recipe.directions:
If using Butter/Margarine bring it room temparature. Mix flour salt & Required water to make a dough consistency. Rub oil over & knead it soft .Let it rest for an hour.
With a help of a rolling pin take a lemon sized dough . Roll it to a a small round & apply some butter/ghee to it. Fold into two again fold the same.Start rolling to form a triangle.
Heat a flat pan ,when it gets hot add the paratha & let it cook for a minute. When it starts to get small bubbles turn around & add a small tsp of oil around the paratha. when the brown spots appear take it out & keep it in an in a covered box.
Serve hot or warm with any accompaniment.

recipe.name: White Chicken Chili
recipe.description: This recipe is "white" version of traditional chili - great northern beans replace the kidney beans and chicken takes the place of ground beef. Lime juice and pepper sauce make this chili tangy, a little spicy and very delicious!
recipe.spices: Ground cumin Dried oregano Chopped fresh cilantro
recipe.ingredients: 6 skinless, boneless chicken breasts 1 cup chopped white onion 4 cloves garlic, finely chopped 4 cups chicken broth 2 tsp ground cumin 2 tsp dried oregano 1 tsp salt 1/2 tsp red pepper sauce 2 cans (each 15 oz) great northern beans, rinsed and drained 1 can (11 oz) corn, drained 6 tbsp lime juice 4 tbsp chopped fresh cilantro
recipe.directions: 1. In a 3.5 to 4 qt slow cooker, mix onion, garlic, broth, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper sauce. Add Chicken. 2. Cover; cook on LOW heat setting for 4 to 5 hours. 3. Remove chicken from slow cooker. Use two forks to shred the chicken into pieces. Return the chicken to the slow cooker. 4. Stir in the beans, corn, lime juice, and cilantro. Cover and cook on LOW heat setting 15 to 20 minutes or until beans and corn are hot.

recipe.name: Apple Rhubarb Crumble
recipe.description: This is a recipe my mom cooks all the time.She says she got it off the internet.It's a pretty standard apple cruble with the addition of rhubarb and maple syrup. Its yummy.
recipe.ingredients: 3 cups chopped fresh or frozen rhubarb 2 medium tart apples, peeled and chopped 1 egg 3/4 cup sugar 1/4 cup maple syrup 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 cup all-purpose flour 1/2 cup packed brown sugar Pinch of salt 1/2 cup cold butter or margarine
recipe.directions: In a bowl, combine the rhubarb, apples, egg, sugar, syrup, nutmeg and cinnamon. Pour into a greased 2-qt. baking dish. In another bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar and salt. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs; sprinkle over fruit mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45-55 minutes or until bubbly.

recipe.name: Cannelloni
recipe.description: Pasta wrapped around a filling, mostly cheese. An old family recipe, we generally serve it at Christmas,though that is because it takes a long time to make and serves a whole load of people rather then for any traditional reason. It should be noted that some people (including myself) prefer the taste without the sauce described.
recipe.ingredients:
Filling 4-6 sausages (mild Italian) 300 grams mozzarella cheese grated 425 grams ricotta cheese 2 eggs 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
Sauce
1 tbsp. olive oil 1 large finely diced onion 1 stalk finely diced celery 1 finely diced medium carrot (optional) water 1 large can of diced tomatoes fresh or dried basil (1 tbsp fresh or 1 tsp dried) salt and pepper to taste chicken broth cube tomato paste
Pasta 5 cups flour 9 eggs 1/2 tsp. salt
recipe.directions:
Filling
Put the sausages in a frying pan and prick them with a fork. Brown on all sides over medium heat. Continue to cook on medium-low heat adding water as necessary to keep sausages from sticking and burning. When cooked all the way through, put them in a food processor with ricotta and mozzarella - you may have to do this in two batches. Pulse until well blended. Put in a mixing bowl and add parmesan, eggs, salt and pepper. The number of eggs can be adjusted to get the right consistency of filling.
Sauce
Heat oil in a heavy saucepan. Saute onion, celery and carrot until soft adding water as needed to keep vegetables moist and not sticking to pan. Add tomatoes, basil, salt and pepper, chicken broth cube and half a can of tomato paste and boil gently for 20-30 minutes. Blend in a food processor. Add more tomato paste if the mixture is too runny or some broth if too thick.
Pasta
Put the flour on counter in a pile. Make a hole in the middle and fill it with eggs and salt. Mix with a fork and clean hands until well mixed. Divide dough into three or four balls and cover to keep moist. Run dough balls through pasta machine gradually thinning. Divide the long strips into 4 or 5 cm. rectangles. Cook in boiling, salted water with 1 tbsp of oil for 4 or 5 minutes. Drain and run under cold water or keep immersed in cold water to keep pasta from sticking together.
Assembling
Spread the cooked, cooled pasta rectangles on a table covered with a clean cloth. Pipe or spoon filling across short end of each rectangle. Roll up and place in a buttered baking dish. Add a little broth to keep them moist. Cover with sauce. A single layer of cannelloni works best but if you are going to have multiple layers in your dish, put sauce between each layer.
Bake in a 350 degree oven until the cannelloni are hot and the sauce is bubbly. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

recipe.name: Vietnamese caramel custard
recipe.description: This is my favorite food. I eat it as a dessert.
recipe.ingredients: 4 Large eggs 500ml fresh milk 300g sugar 120ml water Shaved ice coffee(optional)
recipe.directions: In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs well with 100 g sugar, fresh milk and vanilla powder. Set aside. Into a pan, add half the water and the remaining sugar and bring to the boil. Stir well until sugar melts and syrup is a caramel color. Add remaining water and stir well. Remove from heat. Pour 1 tablespoon of syrup each into 12 plastic or stainless steel moulds. Fill moulds up with beaten egg mixture. Arrange moulds in a steamer and steam for 30 minutes. To test if custard is cooked, simply insert a bamboo skewer into custard. If the skewer comes out clean, the custard is cooked. Remove from heat and leave to cool. Refrigerate until firm. To serve, use the tip of a small knife to go around inside edge of each mould. Then turn custard out onto dessert plates. Top with a shaved ice.

recipe.name: Tex-Mex Style Dinner Loaf
recipe.description: The flavour of this loaf is even better the next day. Leftovers make terrific sandwiches.
recipe.ingredients: 1 ancho pepper 1 cup textured vegatable protein One 15-ounce can Italian or Mexican-style tomato sauce 3/4 cup water 1 large egg, beaten 1/4 cup raisins 1 small onion, chopped 1 small fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced, or 2 canned chile peppers, drained and chopped 3/4 cup dry bread crumbs 1/3 cup all-purpose flour 1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro 2 teaspoons salt 1 teaspoon ground cumin
recipe.directions: Soak ancho chile pepper in 1/2 cup boiling water till softened, for 15-20 minutes. Preheat oven to 350'F. Grease a 9x5" loaf pan. Drain the chile, and squeeze out the excess water. Chop the chile, discarding the seeds and membranes. Combine with rest of ingredients. Pack the loaf mixture into the pan. Cover loosely with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake until set, ~30 minutes. Let stand in the pan on a rack for 5 minutes, then invert onto a serving platter.

recipe.name: Lasagna Roll-Ups
recipe.description: All the fun of regular lasagna, but all rolled up into a lasagna noodle instead of laid out in a pan. Uses sausage meat instead of regular beef and takes less time to prepare and bake.
recipe.ingredients: 12 Lasagna noodles 2 cups ricotta cheese 1 egg 1/4 cup chopped parsley 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese 8 ounces Italian sausage 1 28oz jar marinara sauce
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 350F. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles and rinse under cold water. Mix ricotta, egg, parsley and 1 cup of mozzarella in a large bowl and set aside. Remove sausage meat from casings and cook in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly; drain fat. Spread 1/2 cup of the marinara sauce in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Spread 3 tablespoons of the ricotta mixture onto each noodle and top with some sausage meat. Roll up each noodle and place in baking dish so that the seam of the roll is down. Top the roll-ups with the remaining sauce and mozzarella. Cover loosely with foil and bake for 15 minutes; remove foil and bake for another 10 minutes until brown and bubbly.

recipe.name: Korean Pork Cutlet
recipe.description: This is my mom's homemade Pork Cutlet, known as Donkatsu. This recipe is usaually known in the asian continents, usually thick, fried, eaten with ketchup. The specialty of this homemade pork cutlet is that it is very thin, and crunchy
recipe.ingredients: 2 kg porks 1/2 cup milk 1 bag of crumbled bread powder(either korean or japan) 1 pack of olive oil 8~10 eggs 10 teaspoon of soy sauce or ketchup (for sauce-dipping purpose only) 2 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon sugar 2 lb flour 6 tablespoons water
recipe.directions: In a medium bowl, combine egg and milk; stir it until complete mix. chop off porks into hand-sized pieces. Merge them into this egg and milk mixture for 5 minutes. Take out porks, take and spread out crumbled bread powder into large plate. Coat up the merged-porks with crumbled powder. Make sure you coat every porks completely. Take olive oil into big pan, pour oils down to merge those porks into oil. Take them, and get them into oil. You will be frying them for 15~20 minutes.After that, take them out, they are ready. Take your sauce whatever you want, cut them with scissors, eat them!!

recipe.name: Grandma's Chicken Noodle Soup
recipe.description: This is a recipe that was given to me by my grandmother. It is a very savory and tasty soup and I believe that all will like it. If you would like to add even more flavor, try using smoked chicken!!
recipe.ingredients: 2 1/2 cups wide egg noodles 1 teaspoon vegetable oil 12 cups chicken broth 1 1/2 tablespoons salt 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning 1 cup chopped celery 1 cup chopped onion 1/3 cup cornstarch 1/4 cup water 3 cups diced, cooked chicken meat
recipe.directions: 1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add egg noodles and oil, and boil for 8 minutes, or until tender. Drain, and rinse under cool running water. 2. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, combine broth, salt, and poultry seasoning. Bring to a boil. Stir in celery and onion. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 15 minutes. 3. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water together until cornstarch is completely dissolved. Gradually add to soup, stirring constantly. Stir in noodles and chicken, and heat through.

recipe.name: Taiwanese Kaoliang Pork Ribs Soup Noodles
recipe.description: My family's modification to the well known Taiwanese cuisine - Pork Ribs Soup Noodles. The major difference is the large alcohol contents in this version compared to the original one. One shall be fairly wasted after eating this unless you're an Engineer or Taiwanese.
recipe.spices: "Aged Ginger", "Southern Chinese Ginger", "Black Pepper", "Garlic", "Chinese Wild Pepper", "White Pepper", "Bay Laurel Leaf", "Star Anise", "Coriander Leaf", "Red Hot Chilli Pepper", "Japenol", "Szchan Red Pepper", "Seven Spices Powder"
recipe.ingredients: Pork thigh and large leg bones, Pork ribs, Ramen or Chinese noodles, Your choice of steamed vegetables, Small dried sardiens, Eggs, Sliced dried Bonito, Sliced dried flying fish, Konbu, Black mushrooms, Onions, Green onions, Leek, Aged ginger, Southern Chinese ginger, Bay Laurel Leaf, Star Anise, Apple, Kinmen Kaoiang (sorghum wine, has to be Kinmen made and has a minimum 58% of alcohol or else it just wouldn't do the job), Rice wine, Mirin, Soy Sauce (Taiwanese Kimlan soy sause is most preferred, or any Japanese brand soy sauce, but don't use Chinese or Hong Kong brands or else you'll ruin the taste), Table salt, Black Pepper, Chinese Wild Pepper, White Pepper, Potato starch, Garlic, Sunflower oil, Sesame oil. Prepare a good amount of them because we'll be using a lot.
recipe.directions:
The directions are quite simple once you break them down as different components to deal with, there are 5 different components, and all you have to do is mix them together in the end with the final directions. The components can be made on different days as long as they're well preserved; it takes more than a day to complete all the steps anyways so no point in rushing.
Component 1 - Soy Sauce Extract: Put large amount of Konbu (the more the stronger your extract would be) with sufficient amount of water inside a large bowl and leave it for one day, cut up black mushrooms in slices and put them in a huge bowl full of water and leave them for a night, fast cook the sliced up dry flying fish and sardines along with sliced dry Bonito, Put everything inside a big pot and boil it until the taste is fully trasfered to the soup (remember to take out the Konbu right after the water starts boiling), get rid of all the stuff inside the pot except the soup, pour it into another large pot and add large amount of soy sauce, salt and rice wine in a 3:1:3 ratio, add just a bit of Mirin for the unique sweetness, boil until it tastes really strong but not unbareble. Collect and store the soup well preserved for future use.
Component 2 - Pork Bone Soup: Use a hammer and smash the pork leg and thigh bones until you can see cracks with blood gushing out of them, chop/saw them into managable size, cook the bones in a pot with boiling water for 40-50 min. and throw all the soup and floating goo away, now put the bones, apple, onion, green onion, garlic, aged ginger, a bit of salt and soy sauce, black pepper, bay laurel leaf, Kinmen Kaolian (pour according to the amount you can handle), rice wine, and star anise into the pot and boil (leave the apple and onions with their skins). Boil about 8 hours on stove with medium to low heat, making sure you don't burn your soup. Check often and take out the floating fat and blood, make sure the lid is shut tight so you don't lose all your alcohol.
Component 3 - Fried Pork Ribs: Spray salt and pepper all over fresh spare ribs, marinate them in diced green onions, garlic, southern Chinese ginger, aged ginger, along with soy sauce and of course the most important out of all - Kinmen Kaoliang. Marinate them for about 30 - 60 minutes depending on how strong would you like your ribs. While you're wating for the marinating, mix diced garlic and aged ginger with pepper, salt, egg, and just a tiny bit of soy sauce to make the base coating for the fired ribs, take the marinated ribs out and mix them well with the coating, coat one at a time again inside a plastic bag filled with potato powder. Fry the coated ribs in 180 degree boiling sunflower oil, do this ASAP before the oil goes deadly and cause you cancer. Fry the ribs until they turn totally GOLDEN and buzzing with hot oil.
Component 4 - Hot Spring Egg: Heat water till 68 degrees, turn off the stove, carefully put the eggs in and close the lid steam for 20 minutes.
Component 5 - Noodles and Vegetables: Steam your choice of vegetable and cook noodles.
FINALIZATION - 1. steam and heat your bowl with hot water, get rid of the water once you've make sure that the bowl is hot. 2. Pour heated Soy sauce extract into the bowl according to your taste, just remember that you can always pour more in if you feel like the taste isn't strong enough, so start light. 3. Pour boiling hot pork soup into the bowl making sure that none of the bones and those random stuff went in too. 4. put your cooked noodles and vegetables in, break the prepared hot spring egg into the soup noodles. 5. Place the fried ribs on top of the noodles and season with sesame oil and a small amount of coriander leaf if you like. 6. Prepare a dipping dish of grined up Chinese wild peppers with salt and white peppers for extra ribs to dip in and serve as a side dish. 7. And never forget that bottle of Kinmen Kaoliang; afterall, nothing tastes good without some alcohol!

recipe.name: Chili
recipe.description: basic chili whose spice level can be modified by the increase/decrease of chili power and such spicy ingredients.
recipe.spices: 1 tbsp chili powder (+for spicier) 1/2 tsp oregano 1/4 tsp crushed chillies
recipe.source: I got this recipe from my mom, she got it fro her cookbook(s).
recipe.ingredients: 3/4 lb ground beef 1 28oz can of tomatoes, drained 1 19oz can red kidney beans, drained 3 tbsp tomato paste
recipe.directions: Saute onion & green pepper in oil for 10 min, over medium heat. Add meat + brown. Add tomatoes, beans, tomato & paste, spices & mix thoroughly. Add salt to taste + simmer for 2 hours. Serve with french bread.

recipe.name: Clam Sycee
recipe.description: Clam sycee originated in Shanghai, on the coast of eastern China. A popular New Year's dish, it symbolizes good fortune and prosperity, as the stuffed clams resemble the gold or silver bouillion originally used as money in China. Traditionally, the clams would be steamed before stir-frying or deep-frying, but I've cooked them in wine instead and combined the wine with the sauce for a bit of extra flavor.
recipe.ingredients: 2 dozen clams, such as littleneck or cherrystone 2 teaspoons olive oil 1/2 cup dry white wine 2 tablespoons Chinese rice wine or dry sherry, divided 1 slice ginger 1 green onion, cut on the diagonal into thirds 1 tablespoon cornstarch dissolved in 2 tablespoons water 3/4 cup chicken broth or stock 1 tablespoon oyster sauce 2 tablespoons soy sauce, divided 1 teaspoon granulated sugar 3/4 pound ground pork 1 tablespoon cornstarch Salt, to taste
recipe.directions: Use a stiff brush to scrub the outside of the clams under cold running water. Drain.Heat a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat. Add the olive oil, wine, 1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine or sherry, ginger, and green onion and the clams. Cover and cook just until the clams open (about 10 minutes). Use a slotted spoon to remove the clams from the pan. Do not clean out the pan.While the clams are steaming, mix the cornstarch and water into a paste. Combine the chicken broth, oyster sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce and sugar.Shuck the clams, setting aside the shells for later. Mince the clam meat and combine with the ground pork. Stir in 1 tablespoon sherry, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and salt to taste.Stuff this mixture into the clam half shells. Rub the cornstarch/water mixture paste over top. Reserve any extra cornstarch paste to add to the sauce later.At this point you can either deep-fry or stir-fry the clams. If deep-frying, be careful to deep-fry only a few clams at a time, meat side up, sliding them carefully into the wok so that the oil doesn't splatter. Deep-fry until golden in color and drain on paper towels or a tempura rack if you have one. If stir-frying, place the clams in the wok with the meat side down. Stir-fry in 2 tablespoons heated oil until golden.Add the sauce ingredients into the pan with the wine. Add the clams back to the wok and simmer, covered, for about 20 minutes. Add any remaining cornstarch/water paste, stirring quickly to thicken. Serve hot.

recipe.name: Onion Soup Gratinee
recipe.description: This is authentic Bistro style Potage D'Oignon. Enjoy! It takes a while to make, but is easy enough for anyone to make.
recipe.ingredients: 6 tablespoons olive oil 4 medium yellow onions, sliced 1/4 inch thick 1 tablespoon unsalted butter 1 clove garlic, thinly sliced 4 sprigs fresh thyme 1 bay leaf salt to taste 1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper 3/4 cup dry white wine 2 quarts chicken stock 1/2 cup port wine 6 slices French bread 2 cups shredded Gruyere cheese
recipe.directions: 1. Heat the olive oil in a heavy pot over medium heat. Add the onions; cook and stir until golden brown, about 30 minutes. 2. Add butter, garlic, thyme, bay leaf, salt, and white pepper. Cook and stir for about 10 minutes. Increase the heat to high, and stir in the white wine. Bring to a boil, and cook until wine has reduced by half, 3 to 5 minutes. Pour in the chicken stock, and simmer over medium heat for 45 minutes. 3. Preheat the oven's broiler. Remove the thyme sprigs and bay leaf from the soup and stir in the port wine. Ladle soup into 6 crocks or heat proof bowls, top each with a slice of bread, and a generous helping of Gruyere cheese. Place the bowls on a baking sheet for ease in handling. 4. Place under the broiler for 2 to 3 minutes, until the bread and cheese are toasted and bubbly. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
recipe.description: This is a traditional italian recipe. Due to the name of the dish, carbonara ( or italian for charcoal), legend has it that it was a meal originally cooked for italian charcoal miners. This dish is very unhealthy, so don't make it too often!
recipe.ingredients: 1 pound of spaghetti (also works well with spaghettini or linguini) 1/2 pound of bacon or pancetta 1/2 cup of grated parmesan cheese 3-4 eggs 1/4 cup of finely chopped italian parsley
recipe.directions: Cook the spaghetti until they are cooked but firm (al dente). While the spaghetti is cooking, fry in a big pan (important) the bacon (or pancetta) until crispy. When the bacon is ready, drain some of the fat out of the pan, but make you sure you keep some in. Cut the bacon in small pieces. Mix eggs, cheese and parsley togheter. Add the mix and the spaghetti to the pan, and stir until the spaghetti is evenly coated with sauce and bacon bits. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Peanut Butter Rice Krispie Squares
recipe.description: This recipe is a idea developed from the classic Rice Krispie squares. They have the same feel except the Rice Krispies are coated in peanut butter. It has less sugar and is healthier than the classic squares.
recipe.ingredients: 1/4 cup of butter or margerine 2 - 3 cups of marshmallows 3 - 4 cups of peanut butter 6 cups of Rice Krispies Cereal
recipe.directions: Melt butter/margerine, marshmallows, and peanut butter in a pan on low heat. Put Rice Krispies into bowl then add melted mixture. Stir until the Rice Krispie are covered to your pleasure. Place in pan and leave to cool. Enjoy.

recipe.name: Beef Noodle Soup
recipe.description: Beef Noodle Soup is served as a bowl of white rice noodles in clear beef broth, with thin cuts of beef (steak, fatty flank, lean flank, brisket). Variations featuring tendon, tripe, meatballs, chicken leg, chicken breast, or other chicken organs (heart, liver, tongue, etc.) can also be used.
recipe.spices: Star anise Hot chili sauce black pepper red chili peppers
recipe.rating: Look at the spices, wtf do you think?
recipe.ingredients: 11/2 pound Beef sirloin (Sliced thin) 4 qtz Beef broth (or chicken broth) 3 large Onions, (2 unpeeled - halved, 1 peeled - sliced thin) 3 Shallots (unpeeled) 7 Star anise 2 teaspoons Salt 2 Scallions (sliced thin) 1 tablespoon Shredded coriander 1/4 cup Hot chili sauce 1 package of Vietnamese Pho rice noodle 1/2 cup Vietnamese fish sauce Freshly ground black pepper 2 cups Fresh bean sprouts 2 Fresh red chili peppers (sliced thin) 2 Limes (cut into wedges) 1 bn Of fresh mint
recipe.directions:
1. In a large pot, combine the beef broth with 2 qtz of water. Bring to boil. Add onion halve, parsnips, and salt . Simmer for 15 minutes.
2. Soak the rice sticks in warm water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile, slice beef sirloin against grain into thin slices; set aside. In a small bowl, combine the scallions, coriander and half of the slice onions.
3.When broth is ready, strain it through a strainer into a clean pot. Add the fish sauce and bring the broth to a boil. Reduce the heat and keep the broth at a bare simmer.
4. When ready to serve, put the rice noodle in a bowl and microwave for 30 seconds. Top the noodles with the sliced meats. Bring the broth to a rolling boil. Ladle the broth directly over the meat to cook the raw beef. Garnish with the scallion mixture and freshly ground black pepper.
5.Serve the onions in hot chili sauce and the accompaniments on the side. Each diner will add these ingredients as desired.

recipe.name: Gnocchi Noudles
recipe.description: This is a German/Italian recipe.
recipe.ingredients: 1 onion 1 clove of garlic Tomato puree Mozarella cheese Cnocchis noudles Oliveoil
recipe.directions: Roast the onion and the garlic gently in a pot (don't let it get dark). Add tomato puree into the pot and bring to a broil. Add salt and pepper, additionally you can add other spices if you want. Cut some of the mozarella in cubes and put the cubes in the sauce, cook until you can not see the cheese anymore and add about 2 - 3 tablespoons oliveoil. Cook the gnocchis and serve everything hot. Additionally you can serve small slices of mozarella.

recipe.name: Meat Sauce
recipe.description: This is a recipe I use when I make sauce for pasta. It's an easy recipe to make and does not require many ingredients.
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 lb. ground beef. 1 onion, chopped 1 tablespoon montreal steak spice 1 can of spaghetti sauce.
recipe.directions: In a sauce pan, brown beef and cook onions until they are soft. Pour can of sauce onto beef. Add Steak spice and stir until sauce is heated. Pour over pasta and enjoy.

recipe.name: French Toast
recipe.description: This is a very basic breakfast meal. It is very tasty, and easy to prepare. It is also an excellent way to use up slightly stale bread.
recipe.ingredients: 4 slices of bread 1 egg 1/3 - 1/2 cup of milk 1/2 tsp vanilla maple syrup, applesauce, jam
recipe.directions: Beat egg, milk, and vanilla in a wide, shallow bowl or pan. The bowl / pan must be wide enough for you to lay the bread flat in it. Heat a skillet on medium and add butter. Dip slices of bread into the egg mixture, making sure to coat both sides. Place in the skillet, cook both sides. Top with maple syrup, applesauce, or jam.

recipe.name: Quick Banana Bread
recipe.description: Easy to make banana bread that everyone will love.
recipe.source: Torn out page form a very old cook book
recipe.ingredients: 1 3/4 cups flour 2 1/4 tablespoons baking powder 1/2 tablespoon salt 1/3 cup shortening 2/3 cup sugar 3/4 teaspoon grated lemon rind 1 or 2 eggs 1 1/4 cups ripe banana
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Blend together the shortening, sugar, and lemon rind. Add egg(s) and banana to the shortening mixture, and beat well. Add the flour mixture to the shortening, egg, and banana mixture 1/3 at a time, always beating the mixture until smooth before adding more. Place the batter in a greased bread pan, roughly 8 1/2" by 4 1/2". Bake for about an hour, or until done. Allow to cool before slicing.

recipe.name: Homemade Italian Lasagne
recipe.description: A harmony of rich sauce and sharp herbs makes this Italian dish a real winner. With alternating layers of pasta, cheese, and tomato sauce this meal will have everyone raving! Cooking time: Approx. 1 hour;Serves 6.
recipe.ingredients: 9 Lasagne noodles 1 can ground tomatoes (28 oz / 800g) 1 can Tomato paste - Italian (6 oz / 170g) 10 oz (300g) ground beef 1 - 2 cloves of garlic Tsp Italian herbs 1/4 cup red (cooking) wine 1 cup grated mozzarella cheese 1 cup white sauce 1/2 cup milk 1/2 tsp nutmeg 2 tsp cornstarch Tbsp Parmesan cheese 1/2 cup cottage cheese Grated parmesan cheese Loaf of Garlic bread Bottle of Italian Red wine (Chianti)
recipe.directions:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees Celsius.
Fry ground beef until cooked, mash Garlic & herbs in mortar with pestle, add to frying pan, cook for a minute.Add ground tomatoes, tomato paste & wine. Simmer for 10 - 15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Meanwhile, make the white sauce. Pour the milk into a saucepan & boil. Mix the cornstarch with a little milk. When almost boiling, add to pan - thicken the sauce. Add nutmeg, cottage cheese, parmesan & black pepper to taste. Stir well Ladle about 1/4 tomato sauce into bottom of lasagne pan (9 x 11), spread to cover evenly. Place 3 noodles over sauce. Cover noodles with 1/2 white sauce, sprinkle with 1/3 cup mozzarella. Top with 1/3 remaining tomato sauce Repeat. Place last 3 noodles on top. Cover with remaining tomato sauce. Top with remaining mozzarella & sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cover Lasagne pan with aluminum foil. Bake for 45 mins - 1 hour. Place Garlic bread in oven to heat during last 10 - 15 minutes Remove foil from Lasagne, return to oven to let top brown Serve with Garlic bread (& red wine)

recipe.name: The Whole Jar of Peanut Butter Cookies
recipe.description: These delicious cookies get their name from the fact that it takes a whole jar of peanut butter to make them! The only way you could make them better is to enjoy them with a nice cold glass of milk. Peanut haters beware!
recipe.ingredients: 1 cup butter, softened 1 cup white sugar 1 cup packed brown sugar 2 egg 1 egg yolk 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 (18 ounce) jar peanut butter 2 cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking soda 1/2 teaspoon salt 1 cup chopped peanuts
recipe.directions: 1. In a large bowl, cream butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Add the eggs, yolks, and vanilla; mix until fluffy. Stir in peanut butter. Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the peanut butter mixture. Finally, stir in the peanuts. Refrigerate the dough for at least 2 hours. 2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a cookie sheet. 3. Roll dough into walnut sized balls. Place on the prepared cookie sheet and flatten slightly with a fork. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Cookies should look dry on top. Allow to cool for a few minutes on the cookie sheet before removing to cool completely on a rack. These cookies taste great when slightly undercooked.

recipe.name: Barscz
recipe.description: This recipe is traditional to Eastern Europe and Russia and is more commonly known as Borsch (beat soup). The recipe was provided by my mother and is sweet in flavor. Depending how much pepper you add the soup can either be mild or medium.Try adding beef or cheese tortellini to the soup when serving.
recipe.ingredients: 1 & 1/2 litres of water 1/2 Kg red beets 1/2 Kg of beef on bone 1 carrott chopped, 1 celery chopped, 1/2 leak chopped, 1 parsnip chopped, 1 onion chopped, 1 garlic diced 1/2 cup of dried mushrooms 1 bay leaf 1 tablespoon of salt 1 tablespoon of pepper 1/2 tablespoon of sugar
recipe.directions: Soak the mushrooms in water for 30 min and then combine the mushrooms with the 1 & 1/2 litres of water, the meat on the bone and the salt. Boil slowly, stirring occasionally, for 30 min then add the carrott, celery, leak, bay leaf, parsnip, onion and pepper. Coninue boiling (stirring occasionally) until the vegetables are tender. Filter the solid vegetables and meat from the broth. Set aside. Boil the beets in a pot of water until tender. Take the beets out, peel them and grind them. Put the beets into the vegetable broth and boil for another 10 min. Add the garlic and sugar.

recipe.name: Chocolate Muffins
recipe.description: This is great desert for chocolate lovers and people who are avoiding spicy deserts. This particular recipe will make a dozen muffins.
recipe.source: A pamphlet handed out in a supermarket a long time ago.
recipe.ingredients: -2 eggs -1cup or 250 mL milk -2 cups or 500 mL all-purpose flour -1 1/2 cup or 350 mL chocolate chips -1/2 cup or 125 mL cocoa powder -1/2 cup or 125 mL sugar -1/8 tsp of salt -1/8 tsp of cayenne pepper -1 tbsp or 15 mL baking powder -1/4 cup or 50 mL vegetable oil
recipe.directions: -Preheat oven to 375F or 190C. -In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, chocolate powder, sugar, baking powder, chocolate chips and salt. -In a seperate large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, oil and cayenne pepper. -Slowly add the dry ingredients from the small bowl into the wet ingredients in the large bowl while whisking. -Keep whisking thoroughly until all the ingredients are completely blended. -Lightly grease the muffin pan and sprinkle it with cocoa. -Using an ice cream scoop, place a ball of the mixture into every slot in the pan. -Slide the pan into the oven and let the muffins bake for 20 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean with a few crumbs. -Let the muffins cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Tarallo
recipe.description: A sweet, delicious, round Italian cake with a hint of lemon and a hole in the middle. A yellow, fluffy texture on the inside with a golden-brown outside.
recipe.ingredients: -8 eggs -16 tablespoons of sugar (2 per egg) -16 tablespoons of flour (2 per egg) -1 lemon (grated skin) -1 cup of Canola oil -3 espresso spoons of baking powder -1 'fluted tube' pan
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees Farenheit. 2. Mix all ingredients EXCEPT baking powder together in a mixing bowl. 3. Beat for 20 minutes. 4. Stir baking powder in. 5. Spray cooking spray in 'fluted tube' pan. 6. Bake for an hour. 7. Shut off oven and let sit in oven for 5-10 minutes. --You can sprinkle powdered sugar or cinnamon on top after it's done. You can substitute orange peel instead of lemon skin and you could add some cinnamon in the mix.

recipe.name: Roasted Sweet Potato and Apple Soup
recipe.description: This is an thick and flavourful soup that is easy to make and great for a cold day. Of course, you can easily modify the recipe; try using carrots, peppers, or squash.
recipe.source: My Mom, who got it from a friend
recipe.ingredients: 2 med. Sweet potatoes, peeled 1 apple, peeled, cut into 1? pieces 1 med yellow onion, peeled, cut 2 cloves of garlic, peeled and chopped 2 tbs olive oil salt and pepper 3-4 cups vegetable broth
recipe.directions: (1) Preheat oven to 450. Place sweet potatoes, apple, onion and garlic in a roasting pan. Toss with oil; season with salt and pepperto taste. Roast, tossing once or twice, until soft and onions are starting to brown, about 20-25 minutes. (2) Place half of mixture in a blender, adding just enough broth to cover. Puree, pouring in more broth until soup is smooth and not too thick. Repeat with rest of mixture. (3) Heat on stove and serve.

recipe.name: Tibetan Momos
recipe.description: This is a traditional Tibetan recipe. We make it on special ocassion with usually large crowd. It is served with different designs and tastes delicious. When you take the first bite,it is usually hot and juicy and it compliments with a hot tibetan sauce.\par
recipe.ingredients: There are no set ingredients for Momos. Meats and vegetables can all be chosen depending upon the culinary tastes of an individual. Some of the most common ingredients include,Potato,Cabbage ,Carrot,Onion,Spinach,Salt,Oil,,Water,Masalas of Choice,Meat of Choice (for meat Momos, ie: yak, chicken, Pork, etc.),Dough
recipe.directions: Finely cut and chop the ingredients. The meat in particular should be as finely chopped as possible, however no less than half a centimeter.In a bowl, mix all of the ingredients thoroughly together with your hands. Make sure that the salt and masala are consistently mixed throughout.The dough must then be prepared with a careful balance of water and flour only. After kneading it, place the dough in a bowl. Cover it with a towel and let it sit for 10 minutes. You will know that it is ready once it has a certain spring-like resistance.Sprinkle a little flour on a very smooth surface. Take a ball of approximately 4 centimeters worth of dough, and using a rolling pin, roll it into a flat circle.Pick up the flat circle of dough in the palm of one hand and then spoon in the amount of thoroughly mixed ingredients of your choice.Gently close the palm of your hand while carefully squeezing together the top of the Momo using your thumb and index finger.After closing all of the Momos, place them on one of the specials pans with holes. Place this pan on the cooker with boiling water on the stove. The water beneath the pan causes steam to rise which will thoroughly cook your delicious Momos! They should be steamed and ready to eat in 15 minutes.

recipe.name: Vindaye Ourites
recipe.description: This is a traditional recipe from Rodrigues which is a sister island of Mauritius. Most people fish octopus as their living. They dried the octopus before cooking it.
recipe.ingredients: 3 lbs well clean Octopus 10 small Oignons 5 garlic cloves 4 whole chilies 2 coffee spoon of crushed mustard 2 coffee spoon saffron 2 coffee spoon vinegar 1 cup of oil
recipe.directions: Boil the octopus for 45 minutes in a pressure cooker. Open and check if it is cooked, otherwise, add some water and leave it for 15 more minutes. Then remove from the fire and let it cool down. Cut the octopus in small pieces. Reserve. Preheat an oiled-pan. Add every ingredients but not the octopus. Let it cool down before adding the octopus. Mix the ingredients well with the octopus by shaking the pan.

recipe.name: Chunky Potato Soup
recipe.description: A piping-hot bowl of this soup can chase away the chills on any cold day.
recipe.spices: Crushed red pepper flakes and Ground black pepper.
recipe.source: Got the recipe from my mom.
recipe.ingredients: 3 medium red potatoes, 2 cups water, 1 small onion, 3 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, Crushed red pepper flakes, Ground black pepper, 3 cups milk, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, and 1 cup cubed cooked ham.
recipe.directions: 1. Peel potatoes and cut into 1 inch cubes. 2. Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Drain, reserving liquid. Set aside potatoes. Measure 1 cup cooking liquid, adding water, if necessary; set aside. 3. Peel and finely chop onion. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion to saucepan; cook, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent and tender, but not brown. 4. Add flour to saucepan; season with pepper flakes and black pepper to taste. Cook 3 to 4 minutes. 5. Gradually add potatoes, reserved 1 cup cooking liquid, milk and sugar to onion mixture in saucepan; stir well. Add cheese and ham. Simmer over low heat 30 minutes, stirring frequently. Store leftovers, covered, in refrigerator.

recipe.name: Baked Manicotti
recipe.description: great little dish
recipe.ingredients: 1 package of 16 manicotti shells 8 oz grated parmesan cheese 6 cloves garlic ? minced 1 16 oz tub Ricotta cheese 8?12 oz fresh hot Italian bulk sausage 1 heaping tablespoon freshly snipped flat-leaf parsley 1 quart Bold Tomato Sauce 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper 16 oz mozzarella cheese ? shredded
recipe.directions: Cook the manicotti according to package directions. Be careful not to over cook In a large nonstick fry pan thoroughly cook the sausage, breaking it into small bite?sized pieces ? Drain. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the sausage, Ricotta, parmesan cheese, garlic, cayenne pepper, and parsley. Stuff each manicotti shell with the mixture and place in a non stick baking dish. Pour the tomato sauce over the manicotti, and top with the mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350? for 45 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly.

recipe.name: Tibetan Momos
recipe.description: This is a traditional Tibetan recipe. We make it on special ocassion with usually large crowd. It is served with different designs and tastes delicious. When you take the first bite,it is usually hot and juicy and it compliments with a hot tibetan sauce.
recipe.ingredients: There are no set ingredients for Momos. Meats and vegetables can all be chosen depending upon the culinary tastes of an individual. Some of the most common ingredients include,Potato,Cabbage ,Carrot,Onion,Spinach,Salt,Oil,,Water,Masalas of Choice,Meat of Choice (for meat Momos, ie: yak, chicken, Pork, etc.),Dough
recipe.directions: Finely cut and chop the ingredients. The meat in particular should be as finely chopped as possible, however no less than half a centimeter.In a bowl, mix all of the ingredients thoroughly together with your hands. Make sure that the salt and masala are consistently mixed throughout.The dough must then be prepared with a careful balance of water and flour only. After kneading it, place the dough in a bowl. Cover it with a towel and let it sit for 10 minutes. You will know that it is ready once it has a certain spring-like resistance.Sprinkle a little flour on a very smooth surface. Take a ball of approximately 4 centimeters worth of dough, and using a rolling pin, roll it into a flat circle.Pick up the flat circle of dough in the palm of one hand and then spoon in the amount of thoroughly mixed ingredients of your choice.Gently close the palm of your hand while carefully squeezing together the top of the Momo using your thumb and index finger.After closing all of the Momos, place them on one of the specials pans with holes. Place this pan on the cooker with boiling water on the stove. The water beneath the pan causes steam to rise which will thoroughly cook your delicious Momos! They should be steamed and ready to eat in 15 minutes.

recipe.name: Rotisserie Chicken
recipe.description: This is a great easy recipe that our family loves. It's perfect as the main dish of a simple meal with French fries and cole slaw.
recipe.ingredients: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken 1 pinch salt 1/4 cup butter, melted 1 tablespoon salt 1 tablespoon paprika 1/4 tablespoon ground black pepper
recipe.directions: Season the inside of the chicken with a pinch of salt. Place the chicken onto a rotisserie and set the grill on high. Cook for 10 minutes. During that time, quickly mix together the butter, 1 tablespoon of salt, paprika and pepper. Turn the grill down to medium and baste the chicken with the butter mixture. Close the lid and cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, basting occasionally, until the internal temperature reaches 180 degrees F (83 degrees C) when taken in the thigh with a meat thermometer. Remove from the rotisserie and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes before cutting into pieces and serving.

recipe.name: DanDan Mian
recipe.description: This is a traditional southern of Chinese noodle recipe. I found it from an international cooking book. It should taste spicy and a little bit sour.
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 pound Chinese flat wheat noodles, or linguine 2 tablespoons tahini, or peanut butter 1 tablespoon ground Szechuan red peppercorn 1 tablespoon minced garlic 1 teaspoon brown sugar 2 teaspoons Chinese or white vinegar 2 teaspoons soy sauce 1 tablespoon dark sesame oil 1 tablespoon crushed roasted peanuts
recipe.directions: Boil the noodles. Meanwhile, combine the tahini, Szechuan pepper, garlic, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and sesame oil. When the noodles are done, drain and toss them with the tahini mixture. Sprinkle the peanuts on top before serving.Yield: 2 servings

recipe.name: Pecan Butterball Cookies
recipe.description: Round pecan cookies coated in icing sugar.
recipe.ingredients: 1 cup butter ? cup icing sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 ? cups flour 1 cup finely chopped pecans
recipe.directions: - cream butter, icing sugar and vanilla extract with electric mixer - add sifted flour and blend well - stir in pecans - shape dough into 1 inch balls - place on ungreased baking sheet - bake at 400?F for 8-10 minutes (until lightly golden) - remove from oven and cool on racks - roll in sifted icing sugar when cool - store in airtight container

recipe.name: Super Swiss Potato Soup
recipe.description: There was no description that came along with this recipe, but it sounds pretty awesome and self explanatory.
recipe.ingredients: tablespoons butter, divided 1 small shallot, finely chopped 1 1/2 lbs idaho potatoes, peeled and quartered (about 2 medium potatoes) 3 cups low sodium chicken broth 3 cups water 1 1/2 cups milk 1 1/2 cups heavy cream salt, to taste fresh ground black pepper, to taste cayenne pepper, to taste 3/4 cup grated gruyere cheese (about 6 ounces) 2 teaspoons hot paprika 2 scallions, white and green parts, finely sliced
recipe.directions:
Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a heavy soup pot. Saute shallot in butter until translucent and soft, about 3 minutes. Add the potatoes, chicken broth and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook 15 minutes or until potatoes are soft when poked with a knife-tip. Strain the liquid into a bowl and set aside.
Pass potatoes through a food mill or ricer. Return to soup pot with milk, cream and 1 1/2 cups of cooking liquor. Whisk gently until combined well, but do not overwork the potatoes. Season with salt, pepper and cayenne to taste, then add remaining 1 tablespoon of butter.
Divide Gruyere equally between four soup bowls. Ladle soup over cheese. Sprinkle with paprika and scallions to garnish.

recipe.name: "Oven-Fried" Buffalo Chicken Wings
recipe.description: Crispy, delicious Buffalo chicken wings :)
recipe.spices: ground black pepper anything hot you want to add
recipe.ingredients: 5 pounds whole chicken wings 1 tsp salt 1 tsp fresh ground black pepper 2 tbsp hot sauce 2 tbsp vegetable oil 1 1/2 cup all-purpose flour non-stick canola oil spray large mixing bowl aluminum foil 2 sheet pans 1 cup of your favorite Buffalo chicken wing sauce or glaze
recipe.directions:
It's important to cut your whole chicken wings into sections before they can become delicious Buffalo chicken wings. You want to separate each chicken wing at the joints to give you three sections per wing.
Once you've cut up all the whole chicken wings, transfer the flats and drums to a large bowl. The tips are too small to use in this Buffalo chicken wing recipe.
To the bowl of chicken wings, add the salt, pepper, hot sauce, oil, and your own spices. Toss to coat evenly.
Add the flour to a large plastic grocery bag, or clean garbage bag, and pour in the chicken wings. Twist the top of the bag closed and shake vigorously to coat the wings in the flour.
Cover the two baking sheets in foil, and spray them thoroughly with canola oil. Place the floured chicken wings evenly on the pans, and spray the tops of the wings lightly with the canola oil.
Bake the chicken wings in a preheated 400 degree F. oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and turn over each wing. Place back in the oven for another 30 minutes, or until the wings are golden-brown and the coating is getting crispy.
Once the Buffalo chicken wings are cooked, remove them from the oven, and transfer into a clean mixing bowl. Toss with 1 cup of the sauce, or glaze, of your choice.
Once the chicken wings are coated with the sauce, transfer to serving plates, and allow to cool for 5-10 minutes. The sauce will soak into the skin, and they will cool enough to be easily handled. Enjoy!

recipe.name: Vietnamese Egg Rolls
recipe.description: This is a traditional Vietnamese appetizer made for almost all celebrations, one is Lunar New Year. It should be crunchy and very tasty with all the variety of food inside the roll. This is not my family's recipe because we do not have one so i found it on http://recipes.epicurean.com/recipe/830/vietnamese-egg-rolls-(cha-gio).html
recipe.spices: Garlic Cloves Red chili Dried Chilli
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 lb. raw shrimp, minced 1/2 lb. lean pork, minced 1/2 lb. bean sprouts 2 medium carrots, grated 2 to 3 shallots, minced, if desired 1 oz. cellophane noodles(bean threads) 1 pkg. round rice paper(available at Oriental markets) 2 eggs, beaten Oil for deep frying Shredded scallions for garnish, if desired Lettuce leaves Dipping Sauce(Nuoc Cham) 1 fresh red chili or 2 small dried chilies 2 large garlic cloves, peeled 5 t sugar Juice and pulp of 1/4 unpeeled lime 1/4 c fish sauce(available at Oriental markets) 1/3 c water 1 T shredded carrot 1 T minced scallion
recipe.directions: In large bowl, combine shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, carrots and shallots; set aside. Soak cellophane noodles in warm water about 15 minutes, until flexible; drain, cut into one-inch pieces and add to meat mixture. Toss until combined.
